content.title: Intro
content.content:
1919
Preceded by
1919
1920
Year
1921
Followed by
1921

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1920.

content.title: June
content.content:
11 - German translator Walter Scherf is born.
22 - Voice acting legend Paul Frees, who would voice several characters in the Rankin/Bass movies, is born.
? - "The Happy Mariners" is published in The Stapeldon Magazine.

content.title: July
content.content: 21 - Tolkien is appointed to Readership in English Language at the University of Leeds.

content.title: August
content.content:
16 - Max Schuchart, who would be the first to translate The Lord of the Rings, is born.
19 - Composer Paul Kont is born.

content.title: September
content.content: 27 - William Conrad, voice actor who portrayed Denethor in The Return of the King (1980 film), is born.

content.title: October
content.content:
8 - Nils Werenskiold, the first Norwegian translator of The Lord of the Rings, is born.
10 - Victor Platt, who would voice Sam in The Lord of the Rings (1955 radio series), is born.
22 - Michael Tolkien, Tolkien's second son, is born.
30 - Norman Bird, who would voice Bilbo Baggins in The Lord of the Rings (1978 film), is born.

content.title: December
content.content: 22 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.

? - The Book of Fairy Poetry is published.
Years
1917 1918 1919 1920 1921 1922 1923
